meanings.definition: A person who holds the lease of a property.
meanings.sent1: The lessees of the apartment were responsible for paying rent each month.
meanings.sent2: The lessees signed a contract to rent the house for a year.
meanings.sent3: The lessees threw a party to celebrate their new apartment.
meanings.sent4: The lessees were like caretakers of the property, ensuring it was well-maintained.
meanings.sent5: The lessees painted the walls a vibrant color to personalize their living space.

meanings.sent1: The group of lessees gathered to discuss their lease agreements.
meanings.sent2: The lessees' signatures were required on the rental documents.
meanings.sent3: The lessees decided to form a club for all tenants in the building.
meanings.sent4: The lessees stood out in the neighborhood with their friendly demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The lessees' presence brought life to the once-empty property.
